trigger: Cloning a cDNA from human NK / T cells which codes for a protein with high proline content .
A cDNA clone , <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , was isolated from a natural killer ( NK ) minus T cell subtractive library .
The <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> clone coded for an mRNA of 2061 bp in length .
It encodes a deduced 327 aa protein with a calculated molecular mass of 35.2 kDa .
Searching of <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA and protein sequences against various databases revealed no high homology to other sequences .

However , <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has an unusually high proline content ( 13 % ) , contains a putative nuclear targeting sequence , and has several SPXX motifs which are frequently found in gene regulatory proteins .
One of the stretches of prolines in <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> closely resembles the ligand for proteins with SH3 domains .

Northern hybridization data showed that <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not a lymphoid specific gene and is expressed in a hepatoma cell line and also weakly transcribed or absent in a variety of other cells .
A polyclonal antiserum raised against recombinant <extra_id_0> B4-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> recognizes a 32-34 kDa protein in lymphocytes .
